tasks.task: Setting up and conducting a Farmer Field School meeting
subtasks: Finding a suitable meeting location in the field
Gathering a group of 20-25 farmers from the same village
Dividing the group into subgroups for specific tasks
Monitoring the condition of two priority crops
Assessing soil health through visual inspections
Conducting agro-ecosystem analysis weekly
Observing species interactions and noting synergies
Documenting the presence of shade-providing trees
Tracking plant and tree diversity throughout the year
Discussing resilience against climate events and pests
Increasing crop diversity on farms
Utilizing animal-derived stimulants and botanical pesticides
Implementing intensive polyculture and agroforestry
Recirculating nutrients within the farm system
Communicating agroecological concepts
Demonstrating the importance of diversity
Explaining recycling procedures for nutrients
Discussing economic benefits of year-round income
Promoting inclusion without caste or religious distinctions
Facilitating discovery learning and innovation
Supporting practical, farmer-driven approaches to agroecology

tasks.task: Adapting Farmer Field Schools to local conditions
subtasks: Tailoring training materials to regenerative agricultural methods
Incorporating practices like shade-netting and composting
Monitoring progress and adjusting methods as needed
Ensuring farmer participation and commitment
Connecting local materials and practices to global principles
Documenting and sharing project progress and outcomes
Enhancing farm resilience to climate events
Managing pest outbreaks without chemical pesticides
Increasing overall farm productivity through diversity
